title: Cat. 63  Parau Hina Tefatou, 1893/94
publication_title: Gauguin Paintings, Sculpture, and Graphic Works at the Art Institute of Chicago
content:
<section class="osci-tk-epub-section tombstone" id="tombstone">Parau Hina Tefatou (Words between Goddess of the Moon and God of the Earth)  
1893/94  
Brush and gray wash and pen and brown ink (originally purple, est.), with black fabricated chalk, on heavily textured ivory wove paper; 342 × 248 mm  
Signed recto, lower right, in image, in brush and gray wash: P / G / O  
The Art Institute of Chicago, gift of Edward McCormick Blair, 2002.235  
Rewald 85, Pickvance 85, Druick/Zegers 14  
For the verso, see fig. 63.1

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section provenance" id="provenance">Probably Galerie Druet, Paris.

Sold at Sotheby’s, New York, to Alice Adam Ltd., Chicago, for Edward McCormick Blair (1915–2010), Chicago, May 11, 1988, lot 101.

Given by Edward McCormick Blair to the Art Institute of Chicago, 2002.

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section exhibitions" id="exhibitions">Auckland (New Zealand) City Art Gallery, Paul Gauguin: Pages from the Pacific, Aug. 4–Oct. 15, 1995, cat. 14.

Bar Harbor, Maine, Ethel H. Blum Gallery, College of the Atlantic, From Paradise to Eden: Gauguin in Tahiti, Aug. 10–Sept. 11, 1999, cat. 8.

Art Institute of Chicago, Intimate Encounters: Paul Gauguin and the South Pacific; The Edward McCormick Blair Collection, Sept. 6, 2003–Jan. 11, 2004, cat. 10.

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section references" id="references">Yakov Tugendhold, Noa-Noa: Puteshestvie na Taiti (D. IA. Makovskii, 1918), p. 102 (ill.).

Charles Morice, Paul Gauguin (H. Floury, 1919), p. 176 (ill., detail).

John Rewald, Gauguin (Hyperion, 1938; repr., 1949), p. 22 (ill.)

Maurice Malingue, Gauguin (Documents d’Art, 1943), pp. 137 (ill.), 156.

Victor Segalen, Les immémoriaux (Plon, 1956), pp. 104 (ill.), 274.

John Rewald, Gauguin Drawings (New York, 1958), p. 35, cat. 85 (ill.).

Merete Bodelsen, Gauguin Ceramics in Danish Collections (Munksgaard, 1960), pp. 22, 31, fig. 18.

Ronald Pickvance, The Drawings of Gauguin (P. Hamlyn, 1970), pp. 14, 37, pl. 85.

Jehanne Teilhet-Fisk, Paradise Reviewed: An Interpretation of Gauguin's Polynesian Symbolism (UMI Research Press, 1983), pp. 58–60, 79–80, fig. 20 (ill.).

Douglas Druick and Peter Zegers, From Paradise to Eden: Gauguin in Tahiti, exh. cat. (College of the Atlantic, Ethel H. Blum Gallery, 1999), p. 9, cat. 8.

Douglas Druick and Peter Zegers, Paul Gauguin: Pages from the Pacific, exh. cat. (Auckland City Art Gallery/Art Institute of Chicago, 1995), pp. 10, 51, cat. 14 (ill.).

Art Institute of Chicago, Intimate Encounters: Paul Gauguin and the South Pacific; The Edward McCormick Blair Collection, exhibition brochure (Art Institute of Chicago, 2003), cat. 10.

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section other_documentation" id="other_documentation">Signed lower right, in image, in brush and gray wash: P / G / O

</section><section epub:type="footnotes" id="footnotes">Sotheby’s, New York, Impressionist and Modern Drawings and Watercolors, sale cat. (Sotheby’s, New York, May 11, 1988), lot 101 (ill.).

Alice Adam Ltd., Chicago, invoice addressed to Edward M. Blair, Sr., May 13, 1988, curatorial object file, Department of Prints and Drawings, Art Institute of Chicago.

Charles Morice, Paul Gauguin, 2nd ed. (H. Floury, 1920), p. 190 (ill., detail).

</section><section id="figures">Cat. 63 Parau Hina Tefatou (Words between Goddess of the Moon and God of the Earth), 1893/94.

fig. 63.1 Verso of Gauguin’s Parau Hina Tefatou (Words between Goddess of the Moon and God of the Earth) (1893/94). The Art Institute of Chicago, 2002.235.

</section>
